cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression / Potential Tropical Cyclone (below Cat-1 strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeastward across the southeastern United States during the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana or Mississippi coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning area is along the northern Gulf Coast – Intracoastal City LA to the AL/FL border, including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and metro New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL) Friday–Saturday, then inland through the Lower Mississippi Valley and southeastern United States
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: ATLANTA GA (closest listed point in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at Philadelphia Regional Port; breezy conditions (< 25 kt) possible as remnants pass well south Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – port is well inland on the Delaware River and surge guidance shows no Gulf-generated surge reaching the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could produce 1–2 inches of rain late 21–22 June, locally higher in downpours but generally below 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end risk of an isolated tornado in associated rain bands early next week, but probability is very small this far north
